column4: Question about find: how can I get -exec to run a pipe? I want to do something to every file for which file spits out "ASCII text file, with CRLF line terminators".
find . -type f | while read x; do file "$x" | grep -q "ASCII text file" && do something "$x"; done
I tend not to use -exec much
thanks; that is clearer than what I was thinking of.
